Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall be responsible for the correct setting out of all works, including set out of the various patterns and barrier
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On completion of the set out of the hardlandscaping, the Contractor shall immediately advise the Engineer for the purposes of checking the set out.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The base below the concrete shall be tested using a Clegg Hammer and must have a minimum CBR value of 10. The CBR value shall be taken as 0.07 (CIV)²
Standard / Specification - RITS Drawing 3-60: Roundabout Details. RITS:3.8.3.3 Clegg Hammer
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All exposed aggregate concrete to be at a depth of 125mm. Saw cuts to be 1/3 the depth of the concrete and space no greater than 3M apart
○ Embed each stone at least ½ of its height into the concrete.
○ Secure stones with their wider side set firmly in concrete.
○ Place stones closely together, ensuring gaps do not exceed 50mm.
○ Allow smoother or rounded sides to be exposed where possible.
○ Ensure stones protrude 25-50mm above the finished concrete level.
○ Embed each stone at least ½ of its height into the concrete.
○ Secure stones with their wider side set firmly in concrete.
○ Place stones closely together, ensuring gaps do not exceed 50mm.
○ Allow rugged sides at the surface where possible.
○ Ensure stones protrude 25-50mm above the finished concrete level.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Hinuera stone shall have a split face look (not a sawn look), laid in a mosaic interlocked pattern. The stones must be mortared in place and securely attached to the concrete plinth. Additionally, a penetrating sealer recommended by the Hinuera stone supplier shall be applied, with the product type and specification to be provided by the supplier.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The contractor shall submit a completed and signed installation check list
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All construction as per Drawing L105

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A minimum 400mm-wide ring of 1MPa mortar shall be placed around the RAB to fully encase the Thrie Beam posts within this material. A minimum clearance of 200mm shall be maintained between the post and the inner landscaping interface.
